title: 106_s542
content: The "New Millennium Classrooms Act" extends the age of eligible computers for donation to schools from 2 to 3 years and allows reacquired computers to be eligible for donation. These amendments apply to contributions made after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 45D. CREDIT FOR COMPUTER DONATIONS TO SCHOOLS. The school computer donation credit is 30% of qualified educational contributions made by the taxpayer, with an increased percentage of 50% for contributions to schools in designated zones or Indian reservations. Certain rules apply, and the section will not apply after 3 years from the enactment of the New Millennium Classrooms Act. The current year business credit calculation under the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include the school computer donation credit. This credit disallows deductions for qualified educational contributions equal to the amount of credit determined under section 45D(a). The limitation on carryback of school computer donation credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to disallow unused business credit from being carried back to a taxable year before the enactment date. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code disallow unused business credit from being carried back to a taxable year before the enactment date for the credit for computer donations to schools. The effective date for these changes applies to contributions made in taxable years after the enactment of the Act.
